caseTitle: Federal Board of Revenue thr. Chairman, Islamabad v. Federation of Pakistan thr. Secretary M/o Law, Islamabad & others
tagline: Declaring a statute promulgated by Parliament under the Constitution to be void is a very serious matter. Such declaration may be given on the ground of incompetence of Parliament to enact the law or for a violation of fundamental rights by the enacted law. A declaration given solely on the ground of incorrect arithmetical calculation, lack of rational basis or reasonableness of the statute is devoid of legal foundation. Such grounds, if at all, are criteria for testing the validity of executive action and not legislative measures.
